intro: Big moves in the AI industry this week. We combed through 25+ sources to surface what actually matters — here are the highlights.

articles.title: With co-founders leaving and an IPO looming, Elon Musk turns talk to the moon
articles.summary: According to The New York Times, which reports that it heard the meeting, Musk told employees that xAI needs a lunar manufacturing facility, a factory on the moon that will build AI satellites and fling them into space via a giant catapult.

articles.title: ChatGPT’s deep research tool adds a built-in document viewer so you can read its reports
articles.summary: OpenAI is updating ChatGPT's deep research tool with a full-screen viewer that you can use to scroll through and navigate to specific areas of its AI-generated reports. As shown in a video shared by OpenAI, the built-in viewer allows you to open ChatGPT's reports in a window separate from your chat, while showing a table […].

articles.title: Railway secures $100 million to challenge AWS with AI-native cloud infrastructure
articles.summary: Railway , a San Francisco-based cloud platform that has quietly amassed two million developers without spending a dollar on marketing, announced Thursday that it raised $100 million in a Series B funding round, as surging demand for artificial intelligence applications exposes the limitations of legacy cloud infrastructure.

articles.title: Transformers.js v4 Preview: Now Available on NPM!
articles.summary: Transformers.js v4 Preview: Now Available on NPM!. Published on the Hugging Face blog covering open-source ML tools and models.

articles.title: 9 fun questions to try asking Google Photos
articles.summary: A collage of outdoor images, a blue icon that say "Ask Photos," and examples of Ask Photos prompts.

articles.title: The two patterns by which agents connect sandboxes
articles.summary: Thank you to Nuno Campos from Witan Labs, Tomas Beran and Mikayel Harutyunyan from E2B, Jonathan Wall from Runloop, and Ben Guo from Zo Computer for their review and comments. TL;DR: More and more agents need a workspace: a computer where they can run code, install packages, and access.

articles.title: awesome-ai-research-writing
articles.summary: Elevate your AI research writing, no more tedious polishing ✨ . (5,364 stars, 415 forks) Created 12 days ago and already gaining traction.

articles.title: PaperBanana
articles.summary: PaperBanana: Automating Academic Illustration For AI Scientists. (3,277 stars, 160 forks, JavaScript) Created 12 days ago and already gaining traction.

articles.title: How to Model The Expected Value of Marketing Campaigns
articles.summary: The approach that takes companies to the next level of data maturity.

articles.title: The Strategic Role of a Technology Consulting Firm in Scaling Digital Products
articles.summary: Digital products don’t fail because of bad ideas. They fail because they don’t scale. A startup launches a promising app—but performance crashes under growth.

articles.title: NVIDIA Researchers Introduce KVTC Transform Coding Pipeline to Compress Key-Value Caches by 20x for Efficient LLM Serving
articles.summary: Serving Large Language Models (LLMs) at scale is a massive engineering challenge because of Key-Value (KV) cache management. As models grow in size and reasoning capability, the KV cache footprint increases and becomes a major bottleneck for throughput and latency. For modern Transformers, this cache can occupy multiple gigabytes.

articles.title: A Small-Scale System for Autoregressive Program Synthesis Enabling Controlled Experimentation
articles.summary: What research can be pursued with small models trained to complete true programs?

articles.title: A timeline of claims about AI/LLMs
articles.summary: A timeline of claims about AI/LLMs. Published by Hacker News (AI).

articles.title: AGI Is Not Multimodal
articles.summary: "In projecting language back as the model for thought, we lose sight of the tacit embodied understanding that undergirds our intelligence." –Terry Winograd The recent successes of generative AI models have convinced some that AGI is imminent. While these models appear to capture the essence of human.
